Package org.neo4j.storageengine.api

Interface StorageNodeCursor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, StorageCursor, StorageEntityCursor, StorageEntityScanCursor<AllNodeScan>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RecordNodeCursor
    public interface StorageNodeCursor
extends StorageEntityScanCursor<AllNodeScan>
    Cursor over nodes and its data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void degrees​(RelationshipSelection selection, Degrees.Mutator mutator, boolean allowFastDegreeLookup)
      Visits degrees, i.e. number of relationships, for relationships of the given selection and gives those degrees to the mutator.

    • Method Detail

      • labels

        long[] labels()
        Returns:
        label ids of the node this cursor currently is placed at.

      • hasLabel

        boolean hasLabel​(int label)
        Returns:
        true if the node this cursor is placed at has the given label, otherwise false.

      • relationshipsReference

        long relationshipsReference()
        Returns:
        reference for reading all relationships of the node this cursor currently is placed at.

      • relationships

        void relationships​(StorageRelationshipTraversalCursor traversalCursor,
                   RelationshipSelection selection)

      • relationshipTypes

        int[] relationshipTypes()

      • degrees

        void degrees​(RelationshipSelection selection,
             Degrees.Mutator mutator,
             boolean allowFastDegreeLookup)
        Visits degrees, i.e. number of relationships, for relationships of the given selection and gives those degrees to the mutator.
        Parameters:
        selection - RelationshipSelection to get degrees for.
        mutator - to given the degrees to.
        allowFastDegreeLookup - set to false if there's a need to do security checks, which require the lookup to be done with traversal.

      • supportsFastDegreeLookup

        boolean supportsFastDegreeLookup()
        NOTE the fact that this method is here means physical details about underlying storage leaks into this API. However this method has to exist as long as the kernel API also exposes this. This needs to change at some point.
        Returns:
        whether or not this node is dense.
